```{r, include = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
library(ggpathdiagramr)
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r setup}
library(ggpathdiagramr)
library(ggplot2)
```

For ease of plotting, we will define a base plot:

```{r}
bp <- ggplot() +
  coord_equal() +
  xlim(-4,4) +
  ylim(-4,4)
```


A segment is a portion of a line between two points.


```{r}
p1 <- point(0,1)
p2 <- point(3,3)
s1 <- segment(p1, p2)
```

```{r}
bp +
  as.geom(s1)
```


The line that passes between both points:

```{r}
s1@line
```

The distance between a segment's points:

```{r}
distance(s1)
```

```{r}
bp + 
  as.geom(resect(s1, .2), arrow = arrow(ends = "both", type = "closed", angle = 20)) + 
  label(midpoint(s1), 
        label = distance(s1), 
        angle = s1@line@angle@degree, 
        vjust = 0)
```
